    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVReader

        public CSVReader(java.lang.String filePath)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Purpose: This method is used to generate an instance for CSVReader class It accepts two arguments as parameters
        Parameters:
        filePath - as String
        header - is to set headers to the .csv file. Set here number of required headers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getAllData

        public static java.lang.Object[][] getAllData()
        Purpose: This method is used to read all data of given csv file and populate the data into dataprovider. TestNG will call this method automatically at the time of invocation of Test method, dataprovider will provide data to test record by record

      • getAllDataOfGivenColumnName

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllDataOfGivenColumnName(java.lang.String elementName)
        Purpose: This method is used to return complete Data of given Header as List pre-condition: the file should have the header in the first row
        Parameters:
        elementName -
        Returns:
        Returns the data as List Usage: csvReader.getAllDataOfGivenColumnName("name")

      • getElementDataByKey

        public java.lang.String getElementDataByKey(int recordNumber,
                                            java.lang.String elementName)
        Purpose: This method is used to get the Element/Column data of given record as string pre-condition: the file should have the header in the first row
        Parameters:
        recordNumber -
        elementName -
        Returns:
        Returns the data as String Usage: csvReader.getElementDataByKey(3, "address") Example Output: LA Here, 3 is record number "address" is header name Note: RecordNumber starts from 1

      • getElementDataFromRecord

        public java.lang.Object getElementDataFromRecord(int recordNumber,
                                                 int elementNumber)
        Purpose: This method is used to get the data from given record as an object pre-condition: the file should have the header in the first row
        Parameters:
        recordNumber -
        elementNumber -
        Returns:
        Returns data as Object Usage: csvReader.getElementDataFromRecord(2, 1); Here, 2 is record number 1 is element/header number Note: RecordNumber starts from 1 Element/Header number starts from 0

      • getFileData

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getFileData()
        Purpose: This method is used to read the data from file pre-condition: the file should have the header in the first row
        Returns:
        Returns the complete data as Map> Usage: csvReader.getFileData(); Example Output: {1={id=1, address=Mumbai, name=Senthil}, 2={id=2, address=LA, name=Kiran Kotian}, 3={id=3, address=Hyderabad, name=Nagesh V}}

      • getHeaders

        public java.lang.String[] getHeaders()
        Purpose is to return headers present in the csv file.
        Returns:
        headers in String[]

      • getNumberOfRecords

        public int getNumberOfRecords()
        Purpose is to return number of records present in the csv file.
        Returns:
        number of records else return 0

      • getRecordData

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getRecordData(int recordNumber)
        Purpose: This method is used to get the data from given record as Map pre-condition: the file should have the header in the first row
        Parameters:
        recordNumber -
        Returns:
        Returns the record data as Map Usage: csvReader.getRecordData(2); Example Output: {id=2, address=LA, name=Kiran Kotian} Here, 2 is record number Note: RecordNumber starts from 1

      • getRecordsOfGivenRange

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getRecordsOfGivenRange(int startRecordNumber,
                                                                                                                int endRecordNumber)
        Purpose: This method is used to get the range of records as Map> pre-condition: the file should have the header in the first row
        Parameters:
        startRecordNumber - ,endRecordNumber
        Returns:
        Returns the given range of records as Map> Usage: csvReader.getRecordsOfGivenRange(1,3); Example Output: {1={id=1, address=Mumbai, name=Senthil}, 2={id=2, address=LA, name=Kiran Kotian}, 3={id=3, address=Hyderabad, name=Nagesh V}}
